poem:
**Lobbyist's Reception**

In a room of rustling suits,  
Rachel stands like a question left open.  
Sip of wine meets whispered currency,  
and the delicate dance of influence begins.  
Outside, the city blinks dully—  
a roulette wheel still spinning,  
while she considers each clink of glass  
a wager made on promises whispered low.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rachel Reeves due to appear at gambling lobbyist’s event amid tax review The chancellor, Rachel Reeves, has been urged to cancel plans to be the guest of honour at an event hosted by the chief lobbyist of the gambling industry while the Treasury is in the midst of a review of taxes on the £12bn sector. Reeves is slated to appear at a “private reception” for business leaders, organised by the corporate communications company Brunswick,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
